name: Jingyue Li
content: Jingyue Li - NTNU Jingyue Li Download press photo Download press photo Foto: Close Jingyue Li Professor Department of Computer Science Faculty of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering jingyue.li@ntnu.no +4791897446 S. P. Andersens veg 15B (Room 309) About I am a Professor in the Department of Computer Science at NTNU, earning my Ph.D. in Software Engineering from NTNU in 2006. Alongside my academic pursuits, I have extensive industrial experience in engineering and research gained from esteemed global corporations. My research interests include software engineering, software security, software engineering and AI, and blockchain technologies. I have a solid empirical software engineering background and experience applying design science methodologies to craft innovative tools and methods. I currently serve as the Steering Committee Chair for EASE (International Conference on Evaluation and Assessment in Software Engineering), and as a Technical Committee Member for ICSE 2026 (IEEE/ACM International Conference on Software Engineering), FSE 2024 (ACM International Conference on the Foundations of Software Engineering), and ICBC 2022-2025 (IEEE International Conference on Blockchain and Cryptocurrency). I also served as the General Chair for FSE 2025. I am an IEEE Senior Member and a Member of NTVA. Education Ph.D. in Software Engineering (NTNU) (2006) Industry experience IBM: Software specialist (2001-2002) DNV Research and Innovation: Principal Researcher (2010-2016) Research visits University College London, UK (2005) University of Washington, US (2009) Hiroshima University, Japan (2022) Peking University, China (2022-2023) Google Scholar Profile Publications and Citations Research Research interests Empirical software engineering Software security Software engineering and AI Blockchain technologies Recent research projects AntiGAIAbuse (Peder Sather Grant Project by UC Berkeley) (2025-2027)(PI) TRACE4EU (EU Digital)(2023-2025)(Key Scientist) Platform as Service Technologies for High-performance Blockchain-based Supply Chain Management Systems (PaaSforChain)(Research Council of Norway) (2020-2023) (PI) A Smart Mobile App to Facilitate Rehabilitation of Stroke Patients (SmartRehab)(Research Council of Norway)(2020-2021)(PI) CyberSmart - Cybersecurity, Safety, and Resilience of Smart cities (NTNU)(2017-2020) (PI) SecureCyber: Management of Safety and Security Risks for Cyber-Physical Systems (NTNU)(2017-2020) (PI) IPIT: International Partnerships for Excellent Education and Research in Information Technology (2018-2020)(Research Council of Norway)(Co-PI) CIRCit - Circular Economy Integration in the Nordic Industry for Enhanced Sustainability and Competitiveness (Nordforsk)(2017-2020) (Work Package leader) SAREPTA - Safety, Autonomy, Remote Control and Operations of Industrial Transport Systems (2017-2020) (Research Council of Norway) (Key Scientist) SafeCop – Safe Cooperating Cyber-Physical Systems using Wireless Communication (2016-2019) (EU Horizon 2020) (Key Scientist) Model-Based Testing of Spacecraft Control Software (2011-2013) (European Space Agency) (Key Scientist) Information systems and software engineering Platform as Service Technologies for High-performance Blockchain-based Supply Chain Management Systems (PaaS4Chain) PaaSforChain (Platform as Service Technologies for High-performance Blockchain-based Supply Chain Management Systems) will study and develop platform technologies to facilitate supply chain management.
